intro: Alsobia chiapensis, commonly known as the Chiapas alsobia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine pubescence. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
